title: Blackbody - peak wavelengths of spheres X and Y

content.question: The spectrum of radiation emitted by a blackbody can be represented with a graph of the radiated intensity per unit wavelength as a function of wavelength. Such a graph exhibits a peak wavelength at which the intensity per unit wavelength is a maximum. Two spherical blackbodies, Sphere <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math> and Sphere <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>, are at the same temperature, while Sphere <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math> has a greater mass and greater surface area than Sphere <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>. Which of the following claims correctly relates the peak wavelengths for the two spheres, and cites evidence or reasoning that supports the claim?

choices.label: Sphere <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math> has a longer peak wavelength. The mass of Sphere <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math> is greater than that of Sphere <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>.

Sphere <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math> has a longer peak wavelength. The surface area of Sphere <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math> is greater than that of Sphere <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>.
The peak wavelength is the same for both spheres. The spheres are at the same temperature.
The peak wavelength is the same for both spheres. Both objects are in the shape of a sphere.

content.answer: The peak wavelength is the same for both spheres. The spheres are at the same temperature.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
